channel.title: Tech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Tech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Meta’s Manus news is getting different receptions in Washington and Beijing
item.description: Chinese officials are reportedly reviewing whether the Meta deal violates technology export controls, potentially giving Beijing leverage it wasn't in...

item.title: McKinsey and General Catalyst execs say the era of ‘learn once, work forever’ is over
item.description: Calacanis, General Catalyst's Taneja, and McKinsey's Sternfels discussed how AI is reshaping technology and the labor force.

item.title: A viral Reddit post alleging fraud from a food delivery app turned out to be AI-generated
item.description: When fake content goes viral, the damage has already been done, even if the post is debunked.

item.title: The Inevitable Rise of the Art TV
item.description: New televisions from Amazon, Hisense, TCL, and others are designed to display fine art and look like a painting when they’re switched off. It’s all th...

item.title: California lawmaker proposes a four-year ban on AI chatbots in kids’ toys
item.description: “Our children cannot be used as lab rats for Big Tech to experiment on,” Senator Steve Padilla said. He just introduced a bill to ban AI chatbots in t...

item.title: Wearable health devices could generate a million tons of e-waste by 2050
item.description: The most surprising part is that the plastic isn't the biggest problem.

item.title: CES 2026: Everything revealed, from Nvidia’s debuts to AMD’s new chips to Razer’s AI oddities
item.description: CES 2026 is in full swing in Las Vegas, with the show floor open to the public after a packed couple of days occupied by press conferences from the li...

item.title: Mobileye acquires humanoid robot startup Mentee Robotics for $900M
item.description: Mentee Robotics was co-founded by Mobileye president Amnon Shashua.

item.title: The most bizarre tech announced so far at CES 2026
item.description: From an AI panda pet to an anime girl hologram for your desk, here are the wildest products at CES 2026.

item.title: xAI says it raised $20B in Series E funding
item.description: Nvidia is among the many investors, but xAI has not disclosed if these investments come in the form of equity or debt.
